bibl.title: Letter from Roy Watson to T. James Ennis, December 20, 1951

div1.p: Watson requests that Ennis provide top-quality service for the Hench's when they visit the Hotel Nacional, in Havana.

div1.head: Letter from Roy Watson to T. James Ennis, December 20, 1951
div1.opener:
THE KAHLER CORPORATION
OWNING AND OPERATING
HOTEL KAHLER
HOTEL ZUMBRO
HOTEL GAMON
KAHLER HOSPITAL
WORRALL HOSPITAL
COLONIAL HOSPITAL
KAHLER SCHOOL OF NURSING
MODEL LAUNDRY
ZUMBRO CAFETERIA
ROCHESTER DIET KITCHEN
ROCHESTER, MINNESOTA
December 20, 1951
PRESIDENT & GENERAL MANAGER
ROY WATSON
Mr. T. James Ennis, Manager
Hotel Nacional de Cuba
Habana, Cuba
Dear Mr. Ennis:
div1.p:
Dr. P. S. Hench, member of the Mayo Clinic Staff, and also a
member of my Board of Directors, tells me that he has reser-
vations for himself and wife at your hotel and will be there
from January eighteenth to January twenty-seventh. Dr. Hench
is the son-in-law of Mr. Kahler, my former chief, and a recent
winner of the Nobel prize. In addition, he is a close, personal
friend and a “hell” of a nice fellow. Therefore, I will appreci-
ate any courtesies extended to him during his stay with you.

Mrs. Watson and I enjoyed your marvelous hotel so much I feel
confident that “The Henches” will also.
Wishing you the compliments of the Holiday Season.
div1.closer:
Cordially, (Signed) Roy Watson RW-if
cc to Dr. P. S. Hench
C O P Y
